div.head: Richard Randalls Will
div.p:
August 3rd 1667. The last will and testament of Richard Randall of Charles
County in the province of Maryland.
In the Name of God Amen. I Richard Randall of the county above
said being very sick and weak in body but of sound and perfect memory.
doe make constitute and appoint this my last wll and testament recognizing
and by these presents annulling all forever wills and testaments by mee most
either by word or writing and this only to stand on my last will and
testament.--

I command my soul unto the hands of God my creator where
it shall please him to call me to his mercy to be saved in and
throughout the only meritts and mediations of our lands and favour Jesus-
Christ and my body to the ground to be decently eneterd by my Executor
Item I desire that all my Land debts may bee duly and truly satisfied whereof-
that that of Mr. William Tadons of New England being ten pounds be first paid
by of are at Mr. Anthony Bridges in Virginia and at
Stephen Montagues in Maryland and if they cannot be transfronted then
to be sold and the proceeds to be and if the produce do not ballance
the Debts the remainder to be satisfied of the rest of my Estate.--

Item one Thousand pounds of Tobacco to be transformed to one John Pinke of
Boston in New England a shoe maker
Item I give and bequeath to the Church towards the maintenance of a Protestant
minister forever two hundred acres of land taken up by me called
the addition being surveyed by Mr. Benjamin Roger for me.

Item tis my last will and desire that John Robinson be fully satisfied for the
land I bought of him provided he make the title sure and good two
more to be paid until the title be made clear that what is–
Already paid which I leave to my Executor hereafter named to see it
performed.--

Item I give to Mr. Anthony Bridges one hundred pounds of sugar.
Item I give my Boy Thomas Cooper one year of his time and my old
namely my clothes and my old serge suit and last
bequeath him to Mr. Liddy Michins in north Hampton County in
as also one gold ring in my chest and five shilling
Item I give unto Stephen Montague my silver cup my Rapairs and my
boate and oares I give unto Mr. Joseph Harrison one hundred
pound of sugar and by these presents make and appoint the
said Mr. Joseph Harrion and Stephen Montague my hole and sole
Executor, giving them full to sell and disperse of all my lands,
and goods, and after the payment of my Just Debts and Legasies–
herein mentioned to return what is left of my father Richard Randall
and to aAnne Randall and to their heir forever
Item I give unto my Executor Stephen Montague all my Books, writings
whereof I have hereunto set my hand seal the day and year find above
Written–
Signed sealed and Delivered
In the presents of us—
Samuel Hanis, William Hills
R. Randall
